repnme.cdata!:
Guatemala - Emergency Support for Social
            Services Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Emergency Support for
            Social Services Project for Guatemala were as follows:
            outcomes were moderately satisfactory, risk to development
            outcome was moderate, Bank performance was moderately
            satisfactory, and Borrower performance was moderately
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: this Emergency
            Recovery Loan (ERL) provides a means of designing a
            fast-disbursing project with the aim of achieving
            medium-term objectives that the government and the Bank are
            in joint agreement on. This type of loan can also be useful
            in the event of an emergency where the government is trying
            to obtain funding quickly but not have the lead time to
            implement development policy reforms. Project design should
            take into account the country's existing reporting
            systems. It is important to manage the administrative
            burdens that come with ERL (as opposed to development policy
            loans). These burdens include compliance with safeguards and
            the preparation of operational manuals, even though the loan
            did not finance any investments and only reimbursed teacher
            and health worker salaries. The triggering of safeguards in
            particular created substantial work- including environmental
            plans, operational manuals, discussions and follow-up, in
            order to deal with an issue that seemed beyond the scope of
            the project. Such administrative requirements need to be
            carefully considered upfront and explained to the client
            during project preparation.

Guatemala - Emergency Support for Social

17096186.projn: GT-Emergency Support For Social Services -- P122370

repnme.cdata!:
Guatemala - Emergency Support for Social
            Services Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Emergency Support for Social Services Project for Guatemala
            is to preserve health and education services following
            severe flooding and other natural disasters that took place
            in Guatemala between May and September 2010. This is the
            second restructuring of the project to facilitate the
            disbursement of the remaining loan proceeds within the 2012
            budget and improve the monitoring of the project outcomes.
            The changes include a reallocation of loan proceeds among
            existing categories as well as a revision of the results
            framework. The first restructuring, approved in May 2012,
            extended the project closing date from June 30, 2012 to
            December 31, 2012, to give the Borrower a full year of
            project implementation following a delay in the loan's
            congressional approval.

            Social Services Project : restructuring (Vol. 2) : Data sheet

16457933.projn: GT-Emergency Support For Social Services -- P122370

repnme.cdata!:
Guatemala - Emergency Support for Social
            Services Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Emergency Support
            for Social Services Project for Guatemala is to preserve
            health and education services following severe flooding and
            other natural disasters that took place in Guatemala between
            May and September 2010. The closing date for the project
            will be extended from June 30, 2012 until December 31, 2012.
            The loan was approved by the Guatemalan Congress on November
            24, 2011, and became effective on December 22, 2011. A
            retroactive disbursement of US$40 million was made on
            December 29, 2011, and the request for a second disbursement
            is currently being prepared. The project implementation has
            been satisfactory and progress towards achieving the project
            development objective remains on track. The extension is
            necessary in light of the delayed Congressional approval and
            the resulting delay in the effectiveness of the loan. The
            extension will give the Borrower a full 12 months for
            implementation of the project. This will be the first
            extension of the project.

display_title.display_title:
Guatemala - Emergency Support for
            Social Services Project : restructuring : Main report

repnme.cdata!:
Guatemala - Emergency Support for Social
            Services Project : environmental action plan

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Emergency Support
            for Social Services Project is to preserve health and
            education services following severe flooding and other
            natural disasters that took place in Guatemala between May
            and September 2010. The most relevant environmental issue
            resulting from the implementation of this project is the
            production of Hospital Solid Waste (HSW). Now the every
            hospital and facility in the public health network is aware
            and familiar with the regulatory framework and the standards
            and practices to manage HSW properly. The general
            comptroller conducted an environmental audit in the 43
            public hospitals, to encourage compliance with the HSW and
            waste water management regulations.

display_title.display_title:
Guatemala - Emergency Support for
            Social Services Project : environmental action plan (Vol. 2)
            : Plan de accion ambiental
